revised_title: Catalogue of a Second Thousand of New Nebulae and Clusters of Stars
tldr: The author, William Herschel, presents a catalog of 2,000 new nebulae and clusters of stars observed using his 20-foot reflector telescope. He discusses the methods used to analyze these celestial objects and their significance in understanding the construction of the universe. Herschel also explores the possibility of classifying these clusters and nebulae as part of larger, globular systems, and the importance of understanding their shapes and sizes.
